clinical_study.brief_title: Implications of Self-weighing During Weight Loss Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Implications of Self-weighing During Weight Loss Treatment: A Pragmatic 6-month Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to analyze the effectiveness of introducing behavioral elements in a weight loss program, in this case, comparing the difference between self-weighing versus not doing so.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (0 years) and followed for 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Baseline mean BMI values will be measured and compared at 3, 6, 12 and 24 months. BMI will be assessed on a monthly basis during nutritional consultation through a Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis method using a Tanita BC-418 Segmental Body Composition Analyser/Scale

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (0 years) and followed for 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Baseline mean Fatty mass values will be measured and compared at 3, 6, 12 and 24 months. Fatty mass will be assessed on a monthly basis during nutritional consultation through a Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis method using a Tanita BC-418 Segmental Body Composition Analyser/Scale. Fatty mass is measured as a percentage.

Free-fatty mass will be assessed on a monthly basis during nutritional consultation through a Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis method using a Tanita BC-418 Segmental Body Composition Analyser/Scale. Fatty mass is measured as a percentage.

primary_outcome.measure: Adherence to dietary pattern will be also measured through personal interview
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (0 years) and followed for 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be subjected for an intervention based on nutritional (control group) and physical education (two intervention arms) during 24 months. Partial measures will be also taken every week. In the end of the trial, changes in dietary patterns will be measured comparing means differences between baselines, 3, 6, 12 and 24 months.

arm_group.description: Education, modifying diet and Indications to record self-weighing with a frequency of 2 times per week

intervention.description: The control group is subjected to follow a hypocaloric diet and receives information about the benefits of having healthy habits in relation to decision making and food

The control group is subjected to follow a hypocaloric diet and receives information about the benefits of having healthy habits in relation to decision making and food, but also, they will have monitored the self-control of the weight in order to compare the impact of self-weighing versus not doing it

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having a IMC >25,
- Being sedentary and
- Have not been submitted to a restrictive diet in the 6 months preceding this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suffered from type 2 diabetes or renal conditions
- Being pregnancy or attempt at pregnancy,
- Undergoing antidepressant pharmacological treatment

eligibility.gender_description: the present study is carried out in men
